subsection_name: coi-xuong.json_4_What factors increase the risk of rickets?
subsection_content:
Besides the causes of rickets mentioned above, a number of factors can increase the risk of this disease, including:
Black children: Experts say that black skin is a skin color that is less able to produce vitamin D than other skin colors.; Children living in northern latitudes, where there is little sunlight; Premature babies; Children born into families with a history of rickets; Patients are using certain medications such as anti-epileptic drugs, anti-retroviral drugs that affect the body's ability to use vitamin D, etc.; Children are exclusively breastfed, but breast milk does not contain enough nutrients, especially vitamin D.
